ir.description: The `ticket_counter` function is called with the list of customers.
An empty deque named `q` is initialized.
The first loop begins to add customers to the queue. Current customer `c` is 'A'.
Customer 'A' is added to the right end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'A' joined the queue.
Next iteration of the first loop. Current customer `c` is 'B'.
Customer 'B' is added to the right end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'B' joined the queue.
Next iteration of the first loop. Current customer `c` is 'C'.
Customer 'C' is added to the right end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'C' joined the queue.
All customers have joined the queue. The first `for` loop finishes.
The second `while` loop begins to serve customers. The condition `q` (which is `deque(['A', 'B', 'C'])`) is true.
The first customer 'A' is removed from the left end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'A' was served.
Next iteration of the `while` loop. The condition `q` (which is `deque(['B', 'C'])`) is true.
The next customer 'B' is removed from the left end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'B' was served.
Next iteration of the `while` loop. The condition `q` (which is `deque(['C'])`) is true.
The last customer 'C' is removed from the left end of the deque `q`.
Output message indicating 'C' was served.
The deque `q` is now empty, so the `while` loop condition (`while q`) is false. The loop finishes.
The `ticket_counter` function completes its execution.
